channel.title: Photo Gallery on d00k
channel.description: Recent content in Photo Gallery on d00k

item.title: Westport
item.description: In the summer of 2018, I spent some time in the town of Westport in the west of Ireland. Staying near the bay, the docks as well Westport House were a short walk from where we stayed. The views never failed to disappoint, being at the foot of Croagh Patrick. My favourite memory from here is going off the main path in Westport House, following a dirt trail and coming across a gorgeous red bridge before a short waterfall.

item.title: Lough Derg
item.description: I spent a week around Lough Derg in March 2022. Staying in Dromineer, the village was host to a decently sized Marina, a castle ruins as well as a 10th century church. The area surrounding the lake are full of forest trails and castles galore. The roads in the locality are part of a larger cycling trail. Photos around the Lough

item.title: Trichrome Technique
item.description: Trichrome is a method of taking colour photography using different coloured filters (usually red, blue and green) to form a complete image. It was invented by Louis Ducos du Hauron in the late 19th century. It is most commonly used in black & white film photography to create atmospheric images, however the technique is usable with digital photography as well. How does it work?Shooting trichrome is quite simple, firstly you need lenses.

item.title: Self Portraiture
item.description: Series of self portrait photographs taken for a piece on ‘The Portrait of Dorian Gray’. Utilising various manipulations of light and exposure.

item.title: Low Res Photography
item.description: Low resolution photos taken on a Nokia C3 phone, using the 1MP Resolution setting. Mixture of Trichrome and regular photos.

item.title: Experiments with Light
item.description: Different experiments manipulating or utilising light.
